pageContext.claim: “We don't have problems at our rallies. But they used to send in -- they don't do it anymore. They haven't. They probably -- maybe they will try starting again. But they used to send in protesters, paid protesters. The Democrats and Soros and they came from all over. And we'd have protesters.”
pageContext.analysis: Some protesters at the Kavanaugh hearings were given stipends to assist with possible bail payments. There's no evidence liberal billionaire George Soros paid people to protest Brett Kavanaugh's nomination to the Supreme Court. Soros's Open Society Foundations gave grants for other, specific programs to one of the groups protesting Kavanaugh. That grant money came with strings attached -- most of it was designated for Puerto Rico rebuilding after Hurricane Maria -- and was not used to pay protesters.
